org.jcvi.jillion.trim.lucy

Class LucyVectorSpliceTrimmerBuilder

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.jcvi.jillion.trim.lucy.LucyVectorSpliceTrimmerBuilder
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Builder<NucleotideTrimmer>

    public class LucyVectorSpliceTrimmerBuilder
extends Object
implements Builder<NucleotideTrimmer>
    LucyVectorSpliceTrimmerBuilder is a class that builds a NucleotideTrimmer that finds the "vector free" Range of a NucleotideSequence using a simplified version of the algorithm that the TIGR program Lucy used.

    This Builder object allows you to configure the trimmer to use customized settings.

    Author:
    dkatzel

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  LucyVectorSpliceTrimmerBuilder.AdaptiveSearchArea
      Lucy uses an "adaptive search criteria" to find the vector splice sites that varies the minimum alignment criteria depending on where on the sanger sequence the splice site lies.
      static class  LucyVectorSpliceTrimmerBuilder.AdaptiveSearchAreaBuilder
      Builder object that creates a new LucyVectorSpliceTrimmerBuilder.AdaptiveSearchArea object.

    • Constructor Detail

      • LucyVectorSpliceTrimmerBuilder

        public LucyVectorSpliceTrimmerBuilder(NucleotideSequence upstreamSpliceSeq,
                                      NucleotideSequence downstreamSpliceSeq)
        Create a new Builder object with the given splice site sequences and initialized to use the default Lucy settings.
        Parameters:
        upstreamSpliceSeq - the vector splice site upstream of the desired sequence; can not be null.
        downstreamSpliceSeq - the vector splice site downstream of the desired sequence; can not be null.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if either splice sequence is null.

    • Method Detail

      • onlyCheckForwardDirection

        public LucyVectorSpliceTrimmerBuilder onlyCheckForwardDirection()
        Only check for splice sites in the forward direction. By default, this trimmer will check for splice sites in both directions (reverse complemented). Call this method to only check for splice sites in the forward direction, no reverse complementing. This is not recommended unless you really know for sure that the sequences you will be providing this trimmer are all in the same orientation as the provided splice sequences.
        Returns:
        this

      • build

        public NucleotideTrimmer build()
        Create a new NucleotideTrimmer instance which follows the Lucy vector trim algorithm using the specified configuration.
        Specified by:
        build in interface Builder<NucleotideTrimmer>
        Returns:
        a new NucleotideTrimmer will never be null.

      • alignmentMatrix

        public LucyVectorSpliceTrimmerBuilder alignmentMatrix(NucleotideSubstitutionMatrix matrix,
                                                      int gapOpen,
                                                      int gapExtension)
        Change the parameters used when aligning sequences to the vectors.

        Lucy performs pairwise local alignments between the vector sequences and the input NucleotideSequences. By default, this class uses the same SubstitutionMatrix values, and gap open and extension penalties that the LUCY program used.

        Parameters:
        matrix - the NucleotideSubstitutionMatrix to use instead of the default; can not be null.
        gapOpen - the gap open penalty to use instead of the default; usually a negative number.
        gapExtension - the gap extension penalty to use instead of default; usually a negative number.
        Returns:
        this
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if matrix is null.

      • adaptiveSearchArea

        public LucyVectorSpliceTrimmerBuilder adaptiveSearchArea(LucyVectorSpliceTrimmerBuilder.AdaptiveSearchArea adaptiveSearchArea)
        Lucy uses an "adaptive search criteria" to find the vector splice sites that varies the minimum alignment criteria depending on where on the sanger sequence the splice site lies. Change the LucyVectorSpliceTrimmerBuilder.AdaptiveSearchArea that this trimmer will use instead of the default value.
        Implementation Note:
        the default LucyVectorSpliceTrimmerBuilder.AdaptiveSearchArea as defined by the Lucy paper is equivalent to 
          
 new AdaptiveSearchAreaBuilder()
 					.addAreaRange(40, 8)
 					.addAreaRange(60, 12)
 					.addAreaRange(100, 16)
 					.build();
        Parameters:
        adaptiveSearchArea - a LucyVectorSpliceTrimmerBuilder.AdaptiveSearchArea to use instead of the default; can not be null.
        Returns:
        this
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if adaptiveSearchArea is null.
